revised_title: Genetic Identification of Chimpanzee Subspecies Using Hair DNA and Allele-Specific Probes
tldr: The authors developed a non-invasive method to determine the subspecies identity of chimpanzees using DNA extracted from hair. This method involves amplifying a specific segment of the mitochondrial DNA and using allele-specific oligonucleotide probes for dot-blot typing. This technique can help in colony management, recognizing individuals in comparative studies, and forensic investigations related to the origin of traded animals.
